title: Rate of Change - used car price

content.question: ​A linear function <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math> is used to model the price, in dollars, of used cars as a function of their age <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, in years. It is known that <math alttext="P open parentheses 4 close parentheses equals 7300"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>7300</mn></math> and <math alttext="P open parentheses 7 close parentheses equals 5500"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mn>7</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5500</mn></math>. Based on this model, which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​For each year that a car ages, its price decreases by approximately <math alttext="25 percent sign"><mn>25</mn><mo>%</mo></math>.
​For each year that a car ages, its price decreases by approximately <math alttext="75 percent sign"><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></math>.
​For each year that a car ages, its price decreases by approximately <math><mo>$</mo><mn>600</mn></math>.
​For each year that a car ages, its price decreases by approximately <math><mo>$</mo><mn>1800</mn></math>.

content.answer: ​For each year that a car ages, its price decreases by approximately <math><mo>$</mo><mn>600</mn></math>.
